column4: how can I save all my e-mail folders from Evolution? I would like to  make a whole backup of it, because I have several filters and important e-mails that I don't want to lose!!!
!evolution
how can I make a backup of an entire program with all the configurations and options (such filters on Evolution) Thanks
are you in X?
I have dapper drake 6.10
click on places-home folder.
use my nick when you reply, so it is highlighted for me. Ok, can you see your /.evolution directory?
yep I copied the entire folder .evolution
ok, that isn't what I wanted you to do, try right clicking on the folder, and select archive.
whoops, create archive.
create archive? I don't have an "archive" option
yes.
yes.
OK is working :)
ok, now that file is a compressed tar ball of all your evolution stuff, you could move it to a USB stick for safe keeping.
ok, If you want to save all/most of your stuff, go up a directory, and archive feryana.
that will include .evolution too.
OK. Then when I install Ubuntu on the new pc, when I move that folder I will have all already installed?
nope, move the file back to where it belongs, then right click on it, and extract it.
I know that, I mean, when I extract all to it place, all the software will be installed again? Or I must start from 0 doing the synaptics stufff and all of that
you'll probably have to use synaptic again, unless you can also back up /var, /usr/local, and /etc, even then, you won't be guarnteed a full back up.
